abstract: A proposed “systemic risk council” would have members from the Federal Reserve, Securities and Exchange Commission, Treasury Department and Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.
snippet: A proposed “systemic risk council” would have members from the Federal Reserve, Securities and Exchange Commission, Treasury Department and Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Congress should create an oversight council made up of the nation’s top financial regulators to scrutinize “too big to fail” institutions for risky practices that could lead to the next financial crisis, the chairwoman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation told a Senate committee on Wednesday.

headline.main: F.D.I.C. Seeks a Monitor for ‘Too Big to Fail’ Entities
headline.print_headline: F.D.I.C. Seeks a Monitor for ‘Too Big to Fail’ Entities
